meanings.definition: The front or forward part of something.
meanings.sent1: The ship's foresides were painted a bright red color.
meanings.sent2: The car's engine is located in the foresides for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to hide in the foresides of the sofa and surprise us.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room, shining from the foresides of her face.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth on the foresides of the mountains made the hike enjoyable.

meanings.definition: The side of a building that faces forward.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful mural on the foresides of the building attracts many visitors.
meanings.sent2: The windows on the foresides of the house offer a stunning view of the park.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons like to perch on the foresides of the church and watch the town below.
meanings.sent4: The ivy climbing the foresides of the old mansion gives it a charming look.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight reflecting off the foresides of the skyscraper made it gleam like gold.
